struggle.translation[0].definitions[0].d: to try extremely hard to achieve something, even though it is very difficult
struggle.translation[0].definitions[0].e: Sheâ€™s struggling to bring up a family alone.
The airline is struggling with high costs.
Millions of people are struggling for survival.
Firms are struggling against a prolonged recession.
struggle.translation[0].definitions[1].d: to fight someone who is attacking you or holding you, especially so that you can escape
struggle.translation[0].definitions[1].e: James was hit in the mouth as he struggled with the burglars.
struggle.translation[0].definitions[2].d: if two people struggle, they fight each other for something, especially something one of them is holding
struggle.translation[0].definitions[2].e: They struggled for possession of the gun.
struggle.translation[0].definitions[3].d: to move somewhere with great difficulty
struggle.translation[0].definitions[3].e: Walkers were struggling up the dusty track.
struggle.translation[0].definitions[4].d: to be likely to fail, even though you are trying very hard
struggle.translation[0].definitions[4].e: The team has been struggling all season.
struggle.translation[1].definitions[0].d: a long hard fight to get freedom, political rights etc
struggle.translation[1].definitions[0].e: a power struggle between forces favoring and opposing change
struggle.translation[1].definitions[1].d: a long period of time in which you try to deal with a difficult problem
struggle.translation[1].definitions[1].e: She spoke of her struggles with shyness.
struggle.translation[1].definitions[2].d: a fight between two people for something, or an attempt by one person to escape from the other
struggle.translation[1].definitions[2].e: Police said there were no signs of a struggle.
